subject: Re: [junit] XMLUnit: Namespace prefixes in XPaths
msgSnippet: ... So I set out to patch XMLUnit to recognize namespaces in XPath-based tests. And only after submitting it as a bug report I notice that there already is a
messageBody:
On Thursday 20 January 2005 15:57, Michael Schuerig wrote:
> On Thursday 20 January 2005 14:05, Peter Morgan wrote:
> > So the XPath becomes something like:
> >
> > //*[local-name() = 'bob']
> >
> > Not pretty, but it is the only mechanism that I have found for
> > XPath.
>
> Yes, it gets rather clumsy for longer paths. I had hoped it was
> somehow possible to set the prefix-namespace mapping.

So I set out to patch XMLUnit to recognize namespaces in XPath-based
tests. And only after submitting it as a bug report I notice that there
already is a half-year old patch (different section than bug section)
that does the same. Sigh.

http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1106231&group_id=23187&atid=377768
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=953445&group_id=23187&atid=377770

Unfortunately, judging by the age of the latest XMLUnit release and that
of the older patch, development of XMLUnit doesn't seem to be very
lively.

Michael
